newsitem.title: USA: Wisconsin, Texas declared major disaster areas.
newsitem.headline: Wisconsin, Texas declared major disaster areas.

text.p: President Clinton Monday declared parts of Texas and Wisconsin disaster areas, freeing federal aid to help people in both states recover from severe storms and flooding in June, the White House said in a statement.

The president's action makes federal assistance, including disaster housing and low-cost loans, available to people hit by severe storms and flooding in Wisconsin's Milwaukee, Ozaukee, Washington and Waukesha counties June 21-23.
The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) said damage surveys are continuing in other areas, and additional Wisconsin counties may be added later.
The disaster declaration makes federal funding available to people in nine Texas counties struck by severe thunderstorms and continuing flooding beginning on June 21.
The Texas counties include Bandera, Bexar, Burnet, Guadelupe, Kendall, Llano, Medina, Real and Uvalde.
FEMA said additional counties may also be added in Texas.
